title: Epic: Test Matrix, Fixtures, and End-to-End Acceptance

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Establish high-confidence quality gates across unit, adapter, integration, and end-to-end layers.

Scope:
- fixture corpus by agent
- deterministic tests for mappings and edge cases
- acceptance scenarios matching product goals

title: Epic: Normalization Engine and agentlog.v1 Artifacts

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Build the core normalization pipeline and artifact emitter for agentlog.v1.

Scope:
- canonical event struct + schema file
- dedupe, ordering, timestamp normalization
- JSONL writer and stats generation

Reasoning:
This is the semantic core of the project and all adapters converge here.

title: Program: Build logit Rust CLI for multi-agent local log intelligence

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Background:
This program turns ad-hoc, tool-specific local agent logs into a consistent, queryable operational dataset.
We are standardizing around a Rust CLI (`logit`) with deterministic output contracts and repeatable ingestion.

Why this exists:
- We currently have heterogeneous local traces across Codex, Claude, Gemini, Amp, and OpenCode.
- Valuable context is fragmented, difficult to inspect, and hard to compare across tools.
- We need a durable normalization pipeline so future analysis, debugging, and automation are reliable.

North-star outcomes:
1) One canonical normalized event contract (agentlog.v1)
2) Reproducible snapshot + normalize + validate workflow
3) Optional SQLite mirror for local analytics
4) Self-documenting execution and dependency graph in beads

Implementation philosophy:
- Non-destructive and read-only with respect to source logs
- Deterministic transforms; minimal hidden behavior
- Explicit acceptance criteria per work item
- Strong observability (stats, reports, validation artifacts)

Program-level done criteria:
- All child epics complete and integrated.
- `logit normalize` generates valid schema + JSONL from all 5 adapters.
- `logit validate` can certify outputs.
- Evidence-based test matrix and docs are complete.

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Provide optional SQLite mirror for local analytics without changing primary JSONL contract.

Scope:
- database schema aligned with canonical event model
- efficient inserts and indexes
- parity checks against emitted JSONL

title: Epic: Discovery and Source Inventory (including zsh history prioritization)

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Implement deterministic source discovery across all supported agents with transparent prioritization.

Scope:
- well-known path discovery
- source classification (jsonl/json/log/binary)
- optional influence from shell history (`~/.zsh_history`)

Reasoning:
Discovery quality directly controls coverage and trust in downstream normalization.

title: Epic: Architecture, Contracts, and Safety Defaults

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Define irreversible project decisions early so downstream implementation is deterministic and low-friction.

Scope:
- Canonical schema contract (agentlog.v1)
- Output artifact topology and naming
- Safety defaults (what is retained vs redacted in which mode)
- Non-goals and compatibility boundaries

Why this matters:
Without stable contracts, adapter and pipeline work diverges and causes expensive rework.

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Normalize Gemini JSON sources and explicitly treat protobuf artifacts as indexed-only in v1.

Considerations:
- logs.json may be sparse/empty
- chats session files carry core message payloads
- protobuf decoding intentionally deferred to avoid premature complexity

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Normalize Codex local artifacts into canonical events while preserving provenance.

Considerations:
- rollout JSONL event types differ (response_item, event_msg, etc.)
- history and tui logs provide auxiliary context
- avoid duplicate inflation between history and rollout streams

title: Epic: Snapshot Pipeline (schema profile + representative samples)

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Produce safe, representative source snapshots that are useful for debugging adapters and auditing ingestion quality.

Scope:
- per-source schema/key profiling
- event type frequency summaries
- sample capture (default 3) with redaction safeguards

Reasoning:
Snapshots are observability primitives for ingestion correctness.

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Normalize Amp thread/message payloads and reconcile auxiliary file-change telemetry.

Considerations:
- message content often nested as typed parts
- file-change artifacts can be large and sensitive
- keep transform deterministic and avoid over-parsing blobs

title: Epic: Documentation, Operational Guidance, and Release Readiness

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Make the project operable by future contributors without oral context.

Scope:
- architecture, command usage, safety notes
- troubleshooting and known limitations
- release checklist and acceptance evidence map

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Normalize Claude project/session artifacts including primary and subagent traces.

Considerations:
- heterogeneous event kinds (`user`, `assistant`, `progress`, etc.)
- mcp cache logs are diagnostic not conversational
- maintain source tags for downstream filtering

title: Epic: CLI Skeleton, Command Surface, and Runtime Plumbing

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Create a robust Rust CLI shell that supports command growth without command-sprawl.

Scope:
- `snapshot`, `normalize`, `inspect`, `validate` command family
- global flags and predictable error model
- filesystem-safe runtime behavior and clear exit codes

Design principle:
The command interface is part of the public API and must stay stable once published.

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Ship a strict but practical validation layer that certifies normalized outputs.

Scope:
- schema validation
- invariant checks (required keys, timestamp sanity)
- machine-readable validation report and exit codes

comments.author: HoangNB
comments.text:
Intent:
Normalize OpenCode by joining session message metadata with session part payloads.

Considerations:
- content frequently resides in part records, not message rows
- require reliable join keys (`messageID`, `sessionID`)
- preserve provider/model/cost metadata where available
